alert.note: Alert for Bell; Floyd; Harlan; Knott; Knox; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 1:33PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harlan, Bell, southeastern Knox, southern Leslie, Letcher, southeastern Perry, southern Knott, south central Floyd, southeastern Whitley and southwestern Pike Counties through 200 PM EST... At 132 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hindman to Yeaddiss to near Pruden. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hindman, Bath, Mallie, Ivis, Slemp, Brinkley, Garner, Delphia, Leburn and Leatherwood around 140 PM EST. Pippa Passes, Hollybush, Banks, Drew, Ivan, Omaha, Nealy, May, Hallie and Pine Top around 145 PM EST. Letcher, Cumberland, Benham, Blackey, Defeated Creek, Dry Creek, Hall, Skyline, Greenleaf and Kite around 150 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wheelwright, Fleming-Neon, Lynch, Kings Creek, Flint, Halo, Melvin, Burton, Partridge, Oscaloosa, Whitesburg, Day, Maggard, Oven Fork, Speight, Dongola, Myra, Eolia, Jonancy and Ice. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Floyd; Harlan; Knott; Knox; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike; Whitley
